test-case.name: glob-cxt-item-003
test-case.description: Test xsl:global-context-item with use="absent". The processor may either report an error because a context item is supplied, or it may run the stylesheet with no context item, in which case it fails dynamically with XPDY0002 because the context item is absent.

modified.change: Specification says that 'an error' should be raised but does not speficy which one. In line with xsl:context-item, I've added XTSE3088 as a sensible candidate next to XPDY0002, which implementers may choose not to use, as a context item *is* supplied here, yet is is forbidden

test-case.name: glob-cxt-item-004
test-case.description: It is a static error if more than one xsl:global-context-item declaration appears within a stylesheet module

test-case.name: glob-cxt-item-005
test-case.description: It is a static error if ... several modules within a single package contain inconsistent xsl:global-context-item declarations

test-case.name: glob-cxt-item-006
test-case.description: By implication: it is not a static error if ... several modules within a single package contain consistent xsl:global-context-item declarations

test-case.name: glob-cxt-item-009
test-case.description: If a valid xsl:global-context-item declaration appears within a library package, then it is ignored, unless it specifies use="required", in which case an error is signaled: [see ERR XTTE0590].

modified.change: Added name-URI of the library package to allow it to be discovered
